intro: Goniothalamus aurantiacus, commonly known as the red-flowered tualang, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped leaflets and produces small, round fruits that are edible. It thrives in humid, lowland forest environments and is often found in primary rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
